intro: Chaerophyllum rapaceum, commonly known as the common ragwort. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and along stream banks. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom from late spring to early autumn.
